results.title: All quiet on the Western Front
results.creator_credit: Marble Arch Productions, Norman Rosemont and Delbert Mann
results.brief_description: Made for television, this adaptation of Erich Maria Remarque’s passionate anti-war novel is a remake of the 1930’s film classic about young German soldiers in the Great war of 1914-18, and of the veteran who teaches them to grow up fast in the trenches. Stars Richard Thomas, Ernest Borgnine, Patricia Neal, Ian Holm and Donald Pleasence.

results.title: All quiet on the western front
results.brief_description: Regarded as a landmark in American cinema, and a film which pioneered depiction of the “irony” of war. The directional quality has been compared with Eisenstein for its biting commentary and emotional outcry against war. Its bravura direction fixed in millions of viewers minds the image of youth in the trenches. Lead star, Lew Ayres, became a true-to-life conscientious objector of war after portraying its moving scenes.

results.title: All dogs go to heaven
results.creator_credit: Sullivan Bluth Studios Ireland, Don Bluth, Gary Goldman and John Pomeroy
results.brief_description: Don Bluth, the acclaimed animator of “An American Tail” transports us into a wonderful world of animals and adventure. Featuring the voices of Burt Reynolds, Dom DeLuise and Loni Anderson. Charlie is a rascal but a hero nevertheless. This canine rogue’s michievious streak gets him into serious trouble until he learns the value of friendship and goodness.

results.title: All about my mother = Todo sobre mi madre [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: El Deseo S. A., Renn Productions, France 2 Cinema, Esther Garcia and Pedro Almodovar
results.brief_description: Cecilia Roth plays Manuela, a single working mother whose life takes a tragic twist when her son is killed in a road accident after a performance of “A Streetcar Named Desire”. Manuela decides to return to Barcelona and confront her son’s missing father, hoping that by correcting the mistakes in her past she can find some hope of alleviating the anguish and despair of grief. In Barcelona Manuela finds herself integrated into a new family consisting of transvestite prostitute Agrado (Antonia San Juan), a HIV positive Catholic nun (Penelope Cruz), and the great actress Huma Roja (Marisa Paredes) whose performance as Blanche in “Streetcar” was so beloved by Manuela’s son. Almodovar’s earlier films were absurdist comedies about the sexual and cultural values of a Spain emerging from under Franco’s fascist rule. “All About My Mother” retains his comic surrealism, and the characters still inhabit a world where traditional gender and sexual differences are rendered meaningless, but the film is also a homage to great Hollywood melodrama and in particular the great female legends of the stage and screen. Manuela’s escape from grief occurs only when she can reclaim motherhood, but it is an ideal of motherhood and family not rooted in biology but in friendship and the acceptance of difference. This film says the world is harsh, ugly and unfair but that through the bonds humans make with one another it can also be warm, generous and beautiful. This loving tribute to women (in all their aspects) contains splendid cinematography by Affonso Beatto. (Awards: Winner of the Academy Award and Golden Globe for Best Foreign Language Film. Winner of Best Director Award at the Cannes Film Festival) In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: All about Eve
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F. Zanuck and Joseph L Mankiewicz
results.brief_description: Possibly one of the wittiest and sophisticated films ever made by Hollywood, “All About Eve” is a bitchy and sharp comedy about the jealousies and rivalries of theatrical life. Bette Davis, in one of her greatest performances, is Margo Channing, a self-obsessed, driven and committed actress who is shadowed and wooed by an aspiring starlet, Eve Harrington (Anne Baxter). However, the shy Eve is not as naive as she appears and by the end of the film she is moving to replace Margo and the poisonous cycle of ego and ambition is about to repeat itself. Wonderful adult dialogue, great direction and a cast of excellent supporting actors at their peak (George Sanders, Thelma Ritter, Celeste Holm) makes this movie one of the most entertaining ever produced. Watch out for Marilyn Monroe in an early cameo. Winner of six Academy Awards including Best Picture. Costumes by Edith Head. When they talk about the Golden Years of Hollywood this is one of the films to which they refer.

results.title: Aliens
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Brandywine Productions, Gale Anne Hurd and James Cameron
results.brief_description: The Alien, the perfect organism. A killing machine whose physical excellence is matched only by its hostility. Officer Ellen Ripley and the crew of the starship Nostromo encountered such a creature and she alone survived the massacre. After floating in space for years Ripley is rescued only to learn that she must return to the planet where her nightmare began. L.V. 426, the world where Ripley first encountered the Alien is now colonised. When communication is lost with the settlers, a team of battle hardened space marines is sent with Ripley and find not one creature, but thousands - the Alien is breeding. Cast includes Sigourney Weaver, Carrie Henn, Michael Biehn and Paul Reiser.

results.title: Alien resurrection [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Bill Badalato, Gordon Carroll, David Giler, Walter Hill and Jean-Pierre Jeunet
results.brief_description: Sigourney Weaver reprises her role as Ellen Ripley, a big surprise to most fans considering she died at the end of ‘Alien 3’. In this next instalment of the series a group of scientists succeed in resurrecting Ripley by cloning her. Their main motivation being the Queen Alien which lies dormant within her DNA. Science runs amok however when the alien terror is unwittingly unleased on the scientists spacecraft. The newly revived Ripley (who is a different creature in many respects from her past incarnation), must join forces with a group of smugglers and a mysterious young mechanic named Call (Winona Ryder) to combat the vicious aliens. The strength of the alien saga has always been the constantly evolving character of Ripley and the fresh perspective different creative talents have bought to the series. (Ridley Scott directed the first one, James Cameron the 2nd and David Fincher the 3rd). In this 4th instalment, director Jean-Piere Jeunet (‘City of lost children’, ‘Delicatessen’) populates the film with surreal, womb like imagery, plenty of visceral thrills and a magnificent action sequence set underwater. Cast also includes Ron Perlman, Dan Hedaya, Brad Dourif, Michael Wincott and J.E. Freeman.

results.title: Alien 3
results.creator_credit: Gordon Carroll, David Giler, Walter Hill, David Fincher, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Brandywine Productions
results.brief_description: Continuing the “Alien” trilogy, Ripley’s spaceship crash lands into a maximum security work correctional facility, a monastic community, host to some of the most violent criminals in the universe -but she didn’t come alone. Once again Officer Ripley is pitted against her deadliest enemy, only this time without the aid of advanced technology or modern weapons. This video also contains a 26 minute documentary called “The Making of Alien Resurrection”, which is actually the next film in the “series” after “Alien 3”.

results.title: Alien [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Gordon Carroll, David Giler, Walter Hill and Ridley Scott
results.brief_description: A sci-fi thriller with a difference. The crew aboard the space freighter Nostromo investigate a distress call and one of the crew members brings back on board an Alien of unknown origin. In comparison to the technology dominated sterile world controlled by a computer, where no-one trusts anyone, the horror of the Alien is its very organic nature. Under Scott’s direction this film is grippingly suspensful and draws interesting parallels between the perfect inhumanity of the Alien and that of the Company. Cast includes: Sigourney Weaver, Harry Dean Stanton, John Hurt.
